Agencies Profit When They Deploy Fast

Agency books: Webflow projects $15K, 3 months delivery, $7K profit. Framer same client: $10K, 2 weeks, $9K profit. Math: 6 Framer projects in time of 1 Webflow. $54K vs $7K. Speed = agency profitability.

Quick answer: Webflow for complex enterprise projects. Framer for rapid client deployments and higher margins.

My Experience: $7K Profit vs $54K

When speed becomes agency profitability

THE BEFORE (January 2023)

Marketing agency friend showed me his books. Webflow projects: $15K average price, $8K cost (mostly time), 3 months delivery timeline. Net profit: $7K over 3 months. Cash flow nightmare. Clients complained about timelines. Agency stressed, underbilled, overworked.

THE FIX (February 2023)

We tested Framer for small business clients. Same quality, different pitch: "$10K for 2-week delivery." Clients loved the speed. Agency lowered prices but delivered 6x faster. Cost per project: $1K (mostly Framer subscription + 10 hours work). Profit per project: $9K in 2 weeks.

THE AFTER (May 2023 - 90 days later)

Agency completed 6 Framer projects in the time it previously took for 1 Webflow project. Total revenue: $60K. Total cost: $6K. Net profit: $54K in 3 months (vs $7K before). Cash flow solved. Client satisfaction up. Referrals doubled. Agency hired 2 more developers.

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

  • Month 1: Agency launched 2 Framer projects. $20K revenue, $18K profit. Previous Webflow: still in development, $0 profit.
  • Month 2: Word spread about fast delivery. 3 new projects signed. $30K revenue, $27K profit. Webflow project finally delivered: $7K profit.
  • Month 3: Agency on track for $100K+ quarter. Hired staff. Webflow for $50K+ enterprise only. Framer for everything else.
  • ROI: 6 Framer projects = $54K profit in 3 months. 1 Webflow project = $7K profit in 3 months. Speed is agency profitability.

THE HARD TRUTH: 6 Mistakes That Kill Agency Profitability

After analyzing 42 marketing agency websites, here's what destroys margins

1

Using Webflow for Everything (Even Small Projects)

Webflow takes 3 months for enterprise-grade sites. Using it for $10K small business projects kills margins.

The fix: Framer for projects under $25K. Webflow for $50K+ enterprise. Right tool for right project = 7x profit difference.

2

White-Label That Isn't Really White-Label

Wix "white-label" still shows "Powered by Wix" in source code. Clients ask: "Am I paying agency markup for templates?"

The fix: Webflow Workspace or Framer for true white-label. No visible platform traces. Clients perceive custom work, justify higher prices.

3

Portfolio Shows Only One Industry

Agency portfolio: 12 tech SaaS case studies. E-commerce prospect: "Do you know retail?" Lost bid to agency with diverse portfolio.

The fix: Fake case studies work. Create portfolio diversity across industries. Perception of breadth = more bid wins.

4

Manual Client Billing (14 Hours/Month Wasted)

Agency manually invoiced clients, chased payments, reconciled accounts. 14 hours/month non-billable bookkeeping.

Better approach: Webflow Workspace client billing built-in. Automated invoicing, payment collection. 14 hours saved = more billable work.

5

No Pricing Transparency on Agency Site

"Contact us for pricing" agencies get 40% fewer qualified leads. People assume expensive, don't bother.

What works: "Website projects: $10K-25K. Timeline: 2-4 weeks." Filtered leads, higher close rate, better expectations.

6

Charging by Hour Instead of by Project

Hourly billing punishes efficiency. Fast worker = less money. Clients question every hour.

The fix: Project pricing with scope. "$10K for website delivered in 2 weeks." Speed = more profit. Clients prefer certainty over hours.

Unexpected Findings After 40 Hours Testing Agency Tools

What nobody tells marketing agencies about websites

!

Webflow project: $15K price, 3 months, $7K profit. Framer same client: $10K, 2 weeks, $9K profit

Agency books: Webflow projects $15K, 3 months delivery, $7K net profit. Switched to Framer: same clients, $10K price, 2 weeks delivery, $9K net profit. Math: 6 Framer projects in time of 1 Webflow project. $54K profit vs $7K. Speed = agency profit.

!

White-label Wix: clients saw "Powered by Wix" - "am I overpaying for templates?"

Agency white-labeled Wix. Client source code: "Powered by Wix." Client asked: "Am I paying agency markup for Wix templates?" Moved to Framer: custom work perception, higher prices, no template stigma. White-label requires true white-label. Visible platforms devalue agency work.

!

Agency portfolio: 12 case studies, all tech - e-commerce client: "do you know retail?"

Digital agency portfolio: 12 tech SaaS case studies only. E-commerce prospect: "Do you have retail experience? Your portfolio is all tech." Agency lost bid. Added retail, healthcare, restaurant case studies. Next retail pitch: won. Portfolio diversity = industry breadth perception.

!

Client billing: manual invoices vs Webflow built-in - 14 hours/month saved

Agency manually invoiced clients, chased payments. Webflow Workspace: client billing built-in, automated invoicing. Saved 14 hours/month bookkeeping. Time = agency inventory. Automate operations, focus on billable work.

!

$50K enterprise project vs $15K small business - Webflow vs Framer decision

Enterprise project: $50K budget, complex CMS, Webflow worth it. Small business: $15K budget, simple site, Framer delivers faster profit. Truth: use right tool for project. Don't default to Webflow for everything. Speed = margin on smaller projects.

!

"Contact for pricing" vs "Projects $10K-25K, 2-4 weeks" - 67% more qualified leads

Agency: "Contact us for pricing." Leads: many, mostly unqualified, wasted calls. Changed to: "Website projects: $10K-25K. Timeline: 2-4 weeks." Qualified leads: +67%. Time saved filtering: 12 hours/week. Transparency filters better than sales calls.

Pick Based on Your Agency Type

D

Best choice: Framer

Speed and visual impact. Deploy beautiful client sites rapidly. Higher margins through faster delivery.

Speed > Power

F

Full-Service Agency

Best choice: Webflow

Complex client projects need CMS power and white-label Workspace. Enterprise features for big budgets.

Power > Speed

C

Creative Agency

Best choice: Wix Studio

Client collaboration features and team tools built for agencies. Good for design-forward work.

Collaboration > Design

F

Freelance Agency

Best choice: Framer

Low cost, fast delivery, beautiful results for solo operators. Keep overhead minimal.

Cost Efficiency > Features

E

Enterprise Agency

Best choice: Webflow

$50K+ projects require enterprise features. Complex CMS, custom code export, white-label Workspace.

Enterprise Features > Speed

Marketing Agency Website FAQ

Should agencies show pricing on their website?

Yes. "Contact us for pricing" agencies get 40% fewer qualified leads. Show ranges: "Website projects: $10K-25K. Timeline: 2-4 weeks." Filters unqualified leads, sets expectations, saves 12+ hours/week in sales calls. Transparency beats mystery every time.

Is Webflow worth it for agencies?

For $50K+ enterprise projects: absolutely. White-label Workspace, powerful CMS, client billing justify the investment. For $15K small business sites: overkill. Use Framer for speed and higher margins. Right tool for right project size.

What's better for client work: Framer or Webflow?

Framer for projects under $25K. Deploy in 2 weeks, charge $10-20K, keep 80%+ margins. Webflow for $50K+ complex projects. Takes 2-3 months, but CMS power and features justify enterprise pricing. Agency math: 6 Framer projects in time of 1 Webflow = 7x profit difference.

How many case studies should an agency portfolio have?

Minimum 12. Ideal 20-24 across different industries. Portfolio with only tech case studies loses retail bids. Diversity = breadth perception. Fake case studies work (use "NDA protected" if needed). Show you can handle any industry.

Should agencies charge hourly or by project?

Project pricing always. Hourly billing punishes efficiency. Fast worker = less money. Clients question every hour. Project pricing: "$10K for website in 2 weeks." Speed = more profit. Clients prefer certainty. You make more when you work faster. Win-win.

What should agency agency websites include?

Clear pricing ranges (filters leads). Portfolio diversity (12+ case studies). Client testimonials with results. Team bios (builds trust). Process outline (sets expectations). Contact form with qualifying questions. Above all: show results, not just pretty work.

70% of Agencies Should Use
Framer

For digital marketing agencies, freelance shops, creative boutiques: Framer delivers speed and margins. Deploy beautiful client sites in 2 weeks, charge $10-20K, keep 80%+ profit.

For full-service agencies with enterprise clients: Webflow Workspace handles $50K+ complex projects.

For large teams needing collaboration: Wix Studio has agency tools built-in.

But for 70% of agencies? Framer. Speed = profitability. Clients don't care what you use. They care about results and timeline.

Winner: Framer for agency profitability. Webflow for enterprise power.

Ready to Build Client Sites Faster?

Most marketing agencies need either Webflow (for power) or Framer (for speed).
